snippet: The workers say most in their jobs are denied minimum wages, overtime and sick pay, and must use caustic chemicals without protection.
abstract: Carwash workers across New York City are quietly preparing for organization, tired of being denied minimum wage, overtime and sick pay, and being forced to use caustic chemicals without protection; Adan Nicolas, an Astoria, Queens car wash worker, is leading the charge for unionization in what is the newest front in New York City's labor battles.
lead_paragraph: The workers say most in their jobs are denied minimum wages, overtime and sick pay, and must use caustic chemicals without protection.

headline.seo: Carwash Workers in New York City Plan Union Drive
headline.main: Carwash Workers in New York City Plan Union Drive
headline.print_headline: Carwash Workers in City Plan Campaign for Union
